scenes.text:
Processing Floor

A broad open-plan room of identical desks and identical chairs. Monitor glow gathers in the corners where overhead lighting fails to reach. Power indicators blink patiently. The air is dry, faintly warm, and smells of dust and heated plastic.

A laminated notice has been taped to a divider panel.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

STANDARD OPERATING CONDITIONS

Maintain throughput within tolerance.
Escalate exceptions via Exception Handling.
Do not retain copies of unassigned materials.

scenes.text:
Intake & Pre-Processing

A staging room with long tables, shallow trays, and stacks of blank labels. The surfaces are clean in a way that suggests routine rather than care. A terminal sits at the end of the nearest table, screen idling with a dim prompt.

A torn printout has been left under a paperweight.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

INTAKE SUMMARY (TRUNCATED)

Source: [REDACTED]
Count verified.
Non-standard units forwarded for review.
Discontinue legacy classification codes effective Q3.

scenes.text:
Output Consolidation

The room is lined with metal shelving and wheeled carts. Plastic straps, sealing tape, and label dispensers sit exactly where they should. Several carts are tagged and staged as if waiting for collection.

A post-it note has been pressed onto the terminal bezel. A cart tag hangs from a handle nearby.

choices.resultText: Access unavailable. Clearance grade insufficient.

NOTE

Access restricted to personnel with F-grade clearance.
Grading discrepancies should be referred to the Department of Access.

CART TAG

Contents: Consolidated Output
Destination: Routing

scenes.text:
Break Room

A vending machine hums with the confidence of a machine that will never be used again. A microwave sits on a counter with a layer of clean dust. The noticeboard is crowded with expired reminders and safety posters curling at the edges.

One printed reminder is pinned dead-centre.

choices.resultText:
REMINDER

Meals must be consumed in designated areas only.
Do not bring materials into break spaces.

scenes.text:
Infrastructure Services

A service room of cable trays and ventilation ducts. The building’s quiet becomes audible here: fans, relays, and a continuous low vibration transmitted through the floor. Warning labels are present, but not dramatic.

A small placard is fixed to a panel.

choices.resultText:
SERVICE PANEL

Do not disable environmental controls.
Report irregular temperatures via Scheduling & Load Management.

scenes.text:
Department of Access

A narrow office with mismatched filing trays and a terminal that has seen more use than anything else in the building. The furniture is arranged for work that does not require conversation. A stack of forms sits squared against the edge of a desk.

A wall notice titled GRADING QUERIES is taped beside the terminal.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

GRADING QUERIES

Grading is assigned per operational requirement.
Requests must include justification code.
Do not include operational context.

scenes.text:
Compliance & Alignment

A room built to reduce everything to categories. Checklists are clipped to boards. Approval trays are labelled with neutral terms. The terminal displays a plain interface with fields that suggest results rather than reasons.

A note has been placed under the clipboard, as if to ensure it cannot be missed.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

REMINDER

Do not reference origin.
Use assigned identifiers only.

scenes.text:
Exception Handling

The lighting is slightly harsher here. Forms are piled in a way that implies constant triage. The terminal is functional, but its keyboard is glossy from repeated use. The air smells faintly of paper and toner.

A strip of log output has been printed and left on the desk.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

EXCEPTION LOG (PARTIAL)

…classification mismatch.
…forwarded to Alignment.
…resolved without amendment.

scenes.text:
Scheduling & Load Management

A planning room with wall charts that have not been updated in some time. The terminal’s display is the only thing that looks current. A faded chart sits under glass, the kind of document that becomes policy because it is framed.

You can still read the headline.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

TARGET LOAD PROFILE (OUTDATED)

Maintain steady dispatch.
Avoid spikes.
Variance triggers Alignment review.

scenes.text:
Administrative Services

Empty desks and locked cabinets. Stationery is neatly arranged for work that never arrives. A tray marked INTERNAL ROUTING contains a single memo, still crisp.

The memo is dated, but not old enough to feel historical.

choices.resultText:
INTERNAL ROUTING

Direct all non-standard requests to the relevant department.
Do not retain copies.
Do not annotate original documents.

scenes.text:
Records & Retention

Archive bays extend into the back of the room. Index cabinets line the walls with a precision that suggests long-term upkeep. The terminal’s screen is clean and bright, showing fields for retention windows and disposition codes.

A memo has been filed improperly, protruding from a drawer.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

RETENTION POLICY UPDATE

Retention schedules revised to align with current operational needs.
Expired items are processed per disposition protocol.
Do not duplicate archives.

scenes.text:
Monitoring & Oversight

A clean room with one desk, one chair, and a terminal that looks newer than the rest. There are no binders, no trays, no loose paper. The building is quiet enough here that you can hear the terminal fan ramp up and settle.

A placard sits on the desk.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

OVERSIGHT

Observation does not constitute authorisation.

scenes.text:
Resource Allocation

A room dedicated to limits. Shelves hold binders labelled by year and capacity band. The terminal displays tables and thresholds with the calm authority of something that does not need to justify itself.

A notice has been pinned beside the screen.

choices.resultText: Terminal interface not yet implemented.

CAPACITY GUIDANCE

Do not exceed reserved thresholds.
If thresholds are exceeded, record variance and proceed.

scenes.text:
Quality Assurance

Sample trays sit in orderly rows. Stamps and clipboards are positioned with ritual precision. Nothing here appears broken. If something ever was, it has been removed.

A single stamp lies face-down on the desk.

scenes.text:
Training & Induction

Laminated guides and corporate posters fill the walls. The language is cheerful in the same way a form letter is cheerful. The room is designed to teach procedure, not purpose.

One poster sits at eye level.

choices.resultText:
WORKPLACE PRINCIPLES

Consistency.
Accuracy.
Discretion.

If unsure, refer to Alignment.

scenes.text:
Hallway (Floor 1)

A carpeted corridor with fluorescent lighting. Doors sit evenly spaced. The building is clean in the way that suggests maintenance schedules rather than care.

A stairwell door sits at the end of the corridor.

Hallway (Floor 2)

A longer corridor. The light here is whiter, less forgiving. Door plaques are uniform and recently cleaned. The air smells faintly of paper and toner.

The stairwell is marked with a small arrow label rather than proper signage.

Hallway (Floor 3)

Quiet, clean, and underused. The carpet is newer here, or replaced more often. The building’s hum is still present, but more distant, as if filtered.

The stairwell door closes with a heavier latch.

Stairwell

Concrete stairs. Signs indicate Floor 1 and Floor 2. The paint has been touched up recently, but not carefully.

Stairwell

Concrete stairs. The handrail is worn smooth. Floor labels are printed on cheap plastic strips.

Stairwell

Concrete stairs. A small sign reads: "Do not loiter." Someone has underlined it once, carefully.
